bug.author: r0l1
bug.summary: Reshape Layer: Assertion failed dstTotal != 0 in function 'computeShapeByReshapeMask'
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
OpenCV => 4.4.0 Operating System / Platform => Arch 64 Bit Compiler => GCC 10.2.0
<denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
Loading the following ONNX model causes OpenCV to fail with: <denchmark-code>cv2.error: OpenCV(4.4.0) /build/opencv/src/opencv-4.4.0/modules/dnn/src/layers/reshape_layer.cpp:149: error: (-215:Assertion failed) dstTotal != 0 in function 'computeShapeByReshapeMask' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
import cv2 net=cv2.dnn.readNetFromONNX('model.onnx') The model is quite big. But I'll upload it if required. Thanks in advance for some hints!

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/l-bat>@l-bat</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dkurt>@dkurt</denchmark-link> any ideas how to apply a quick fix? Thanks!
Please upload ONNX model to reproduce error

Here you go: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/files/5149233/model.onnx.txt>model.onnx.txt</denchmark-link>
I adapted the input layers for a smaller model size. import cv2 net=cv2.dnn.readNetFromONNX('model.onnx.txt')

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/l-bat>@l-bat</denchmark-link> awesome! Thanks for the fast solution. Loading the model works, but forwarding still fails. <denchmark-code>[ERROR:0] global /tmp/opencv/opencv/modules/dnn/src/dnn.cpp (3433) getLayerShapesRecursively OPENCV/DNN: [Convolution]:(convolution_output6): getMemoryShapes() throws exception. inputs=1 outputs=0/1 blobs=2 [ERROR:0] global /tmp/opencv/opencv/modules/dnn/src/dnn.cpp (3439) getLayerShapesRecursively input[0] = [ 1 17 1 17 ] [ERROR:0] global /tmp/opencv/opencv/modules/dnn/src/dnn.cpp (3447) getLayerShapesRecursively blobs[0] = CV_32FC1 [ 64 1 3 3 ] [ERROR:0] global /tmp/opencv/opencv/modules/dnn/src/dnn.cpp (3447) getLayerShapesRecursively blobs[1] = CV_32FC1 [ 64 1 ] [ERROR:0] global /tmp/opencv/opencv/modules/dnn/src/dnn.cpp (3449) getLayerShapesRecursively Exception message: OpenCV(4.4.0-dev) /tmp/opencv/opencv/modules/dnn/src/layers/convolution_layer.cpp:353: error: (-215:Assertion failed) ngroups > 0 && inpCn % ngroups == 0 && outCn % ngroups == 0 in function 'getMemoryShapes' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/r0l1>@r0l1</denchmark-link> please provide your code to run model
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/l-bat>@l-bat</denchmark-link> my bad. There was a problem with NCHW & NHWC ordering. Works just fine. Thanks! The PR can be merged.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/r0l1>@r0l1</denchmark-link> , thank you for a bug report.

@l-bat awesome! Thanks for the fast solution. Loading the model works, but forwarding still fails.
Can you step-by-step instructions? I'm a newbie, I want to load onnx model, but I have the same problem

Can you step-by-step instructions? I'm a newbie, I want to load onnx model, but I have the same problem
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/duongvvuet>@duongvvuet</denchmark-link> Please upload ONNX model to reproduce error

Can you step-by-step instructions? I'm a newbie, I want to load onnx model, but I have the same problem
@duongvvuet Please upload ONNX model to reproduce error
Thanks for your respone ! My ONNX model and code ... <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/files/5306767/model.onnx.zip>model.onnx.zip</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>import cv2 model = cv2.dnn.readNetFromONNX("model.onnx") </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/duongvvuet>@duongvvuet</denchmark-link> To load onnx model correctly, you need to specify in input shape when exporting model to onnx. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22346860/94771123-2b98c080-03bf-11eb-9cce-8254bff27274.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/l-bat>@l-bat</denchmark-link> How to specify img_w in the input shape from onnx above? I don't have model before exporting model to onnx. :((
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/duongvvuet>@duongvvuet</denchmark-link> Do you plan to use a model with different input shapes?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/l-bat>@l-bat</denchmark-link> No, I will preprocess the input image with specified input shape.

Try using this script to set input shapes. import onnx import os from onnx.tools import update_model_dims
# Preprocessing: load the old model old_model_path = os.path.join('content', 'model.onnx') onnx_model = onnx.load(old_model_path)
# Preprocessing: get the path to the saved model new_model_path = os.path.join('content', 'new_model.onnx')
# Save the ONNX model variable_length_model = update_model_dims.update_inputs_outputs_dims(onnx_model, {'input': ['batch', 3, 32, 32]}, {'out': [64, 1, 5531]}) onnx.save(onnx_model, new_model_path)
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/l-bat>@l-bat</denchmark-link> Sorry, I'm bad. Thank you so much .. !!
